title: Welcome to Player Behavior!
body:
Confused over a punishment you received?
Have questions about how the Player Behavior systems work?

We’ve got you covered.  This Board is all about answering these types of questions.  Between the [Advisor volunteer program](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/opVBd7rZ-introducing-the-arbiters) and Rioters, we will provide as much feedback and information as we can.

Remember, the more information you provide, the more helpful we can be.  Help us help you!

replies.body: Ok so this is what I don't understand. I received a 2 week suspension for "toxicity". Tell me how this works. It is almost like Riot is just going off of how many people report you instead of the situation and what the other person said as well. It is not right. You could be playing norms and have a whole team full of people that are friends. This is my situation- I played draft- I called adc this other person calls support. Sounds fine? Then we get into the game and he takes every single bit of farm I have and builds damage as a support. So I refused to go the lane with him. How am I supposed to play adc and do well if I cant get any farm or kills? Should I be subjected to build a gold item as an adc because this guy didn't follow the rules of the game? Then because they are all friends I get reported by all of them and get banned. It is absolutely ridiculous. Riot doesn't care about the situation they don't take the time to read into it. They just take your chat logs and the number of reports and call it a day. I think the system needs a huge fix. Why have a mute button if people don't use it? Why not focus more intent on the intentional feeders. I never see them get banned???? It is obsurd. You should have to be 18 years or older to play the game because the game is exactly like games such as call of duty. People talk bad about each other all the time to get hyped. That is the reason there is a mute button so people don't have to let it affect their game play. Simple. I don't understand why Riot is so harsh and not focusing their needs on the feeders. The people who REALLY ruin the game for others.

What's even worse is how the actual abuser teams up to report a user as a team and reports a person who is not the problem and that person gets the ban.... while the actual rude team gets off with nothing. Its nothing short of mob rules.... and the Riot admins and employees are some of the worst offenders.
I have the same problem. I don't know what riot support is doing, but they screwed up with their new banning system.
I have had 2 chat bans because of this , and a leaver buster currently along with one of the bans im trying to get rid of.

YEP. SAME thing. 2 week ban cause someone else decided to ruin the game. Thanks for making words more important than the real trolls of this community. Really should look in to my ban. Team mate feeds my lane cause the adc died once.

So, overall, this is an interesting question.  My expectation is that moderation will eventually get the option to move threads, but development resources are stretched super thin right now when it comes to the Boards.  

I totally agree with you, I think it'd be a lot healthier to have threads moved rather than deleted, but I'm just not sure when it might be a feasible thing to have around.

On the topic of player behavior, what is/can be done in the future about players with passive/aggressive, condescending god complexes? Not just the super toxic ones who are non stop griefing in game, but the other ones that are toxic before the game has even begun. For example: Another player purposely banned my pick, then said "i looked you up" " you suck as__" then told me not to play ranked. There is nothing i can do other than try to find another pick in time after the intial shock of my pick being intentionally banned by my teammate, which resulted in the lock in timer running out and me recieving leaver buster for not locking in. Clearly, regardless of my alleged skill level of said champion, banning a teammates pick should ABSOLUTELY be a reportable offense, because not only did i get punished for his/her decision, i also have no way of getting justice for their wrongdoings. Im sure this has happened to others in the past, but it shouldnt happen unpunished in the future.

We're looking at other option/avenues to allow banned players to discuss their violations/suspensions but requires development and testing.

Sorry but that is not true. If you're being a jerk then you're gonna get in trouble regardless of who you are. We don't have to like everyone or agree with everyone but Riot expects us all to interact with others in a neutral or positive and respectful manner. The people who get downvoted allot are usually: 

A. Known forum trolls who are just spouting nonsense and lies.
B. Banned troll ragers who try to act like they did nothing wrong before proceeding to rage and flame at others who try to explain to them why their behavior is unacceptable and/or call them out on their poor behavior.

No one agrees with every single one of Riot's decisions, but the ones getting downvoted are often those who lash out at anyone who disagrees with them.

I can't get rewards because of a situation that put me on behavior restrictions, but I did not get banned, but muted for 10 games, and even after those 10 games I can't receive my rewards. The team I was with was a group of friends, because once I got upset with my Jungler for not assisting me when I asked numerous times. Then the team trashes me. I did retaliate which was a mistake on my part, but sadly nothing had happened to them when I reported them. Point being, Riot could care less about the people who play the game, meaning they will punish the one who gets reported by the entire team even though that person was not in the wrong. If you really want to not deal with the problem, don't play **League of Legends**. That's pretty much their view on people's trouble with the game since they have plenty more people who will still play, and someone is likely to fill your spot.

Every one of them is downvoted to basically the bottom of each thread, so there's definitely some community control going on.

I'd rather my questions not be handled by TheCurator, I've not had good experiences in dealing with him and find his methods to be very lackadaisical.  Likewise I've also been verbally abused by SlumberJack, but for the time being I'm still open to hearing from any forum mods other than those 2.

>I thank you for the input and thoughts on this matter.

No worries, happy to help.

>I'd rather my questions not be handled by TheCurator, I've not had good experiences in dealing with him and find his methods to be very lackadaisical.

Interesting.

Honestly, my assumption is that the comments to which you're referring are considered low-grade enough that it's fine for them to stay downvoted but not removed.  The community pretty clearly doesn't approve of that stuff, but at the same time I feel like it's important that we make sure moderation doesn't feel stifling.

We're going to see abrasive commenting from time to time, and the downvote system seems to be working as intended in bringing that stuff way down in visibility.

Yes, the ones we're discussing this time are little more harmful than the annoying yappings of a chihuahua, but the previous discussions with TheCurator I referred to were involving more substantial offenses.

He stated a belief of leniency towards real verbal abuse, excessive unjustifiable profanity and repeat offenses.  I'd hardly consider action against those types of offenses to be overly stifling and inaction becomes less "lenient" and more lazy.  Choosing to never take action unless a specific list of conditions be perfectly met, like a robot.  Thus is how I've come to this opinion of his personality.

I'd hardly consider action against those types of offenses to be overly stifling and inaction becomes less "lenient" and more lazy.  Choosing to never take action unless a specific list of conditions be perfectly met, like a robot.  Thus is how I've come to this opinion of his personality.

To be clear, the moderation staff is not lenient towards what is "real verbal abuse, excessive unjustifiable profanity and repeat offenses".  If anyone believes that a post should be reviewed by a moderator, by all means report it and we'll review it.

That being said, just because you don't like something someone says to you on an online forum doesn't make it offensive by our guidelines.  You're not going to always agree with everyone online and you shouldn't.  Healthy debate is a positive thing.  If someone tries to derail that debate pointlessly, then as Daen previously commented, the community itself can handle most negative, troll commentary on its own by either ignoring it or downvoting it.

The moderation staff will continue to step in if someone crosses the line into truly abusive or toxic commentary.

If your primary Boards account has been permanently suspended and you post on another account, that account will also be permanently suspended as ban evasion is not allowed on the Boards.  If it is a temporary suspension, you can still post on another account currently.
